Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Aging \Ag"ing\, n. the process by which objects or materials acquire desirable qualities by being left undisturbed for some time under specific conditions. It is used mostly for foods snd beverages, but also for other materials. [Also spelled {ageing}.] [WordNet 1.5 +PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Age \Age\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Aged}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Aging}.] To grow aged; to become old; to show marks of age; as, he grew fat as he aged. [1913 Webster]
They live one hundred and thirty years, and never age for all that. --Holland. [1913 Webster]
I am aging; that is, I have a whitish, or rather a light-colored, hair here and there. --Landor. [1913 Webster]

aging adj : growing old [syn: {ageing}, {senescent}] n 1: the organic process of growing older and showing the effects of increasing age [syn: {ageing}, {senescence}] 2: acquiring desirable qualities by being left undisturbed for some time [syn: {ripening}, {ageing}]
